name: Country Inn at Jiminy Peak

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at Jiminy a few times this year. Once in the Inn, and in 2 different rental accomadations through the Country Inn. The Inn and the condos above JJ's Lodge can be noisy, but the location is great, right at the bottom of the lodge. The bed in the Country Inn during our last stay was super comfortable and had great pillows. The food court in JJ's Lodge is expensive but the food is very good.
reviews.title: Great ski resort in the lower northeast.

reviews.text: We went mid -week in March and there were no lines and got in 16 runs our 2nd day while it snowed - the sun in the am softened up the trails and then some fresh snow - it was great. The first day it was icy on some trails - as you expect in March in the Northeast!
reviews.title: Better than I thought

reviews.text: Love the new ski ticket system - no more making sure your ski ticket is visible or isn't going to flap around in your face. It's a nice size mountain, especially if you have a teenager who doesn't want to stay with his slow parents - we were quite comfortable letting our 13 year old son go off on his andjust meet us a the fire pit every so often.
reviews.title: Good value great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are looking forward to going back next winter.
reviews.title: Awesome spot!

reviews.text: Great place for a family. Although be prepared lots of children running around. Very kid oriented. We were surprised because it's like a little Vail without the shops. Very self contained. You can park the car and never leave. Restaurants are good for a ski area. Staff is very friendly. We don't have children but would go back probably during the weekdays.
reviews.title: convenient but not worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Jiminy Peak for the opening weekend at the Tanglewood opening weekend. It is about 35 minutes drive from the hotel to Tanglewood, but there are so many scenic routes to take that the journeys were a pleasure.
reviews.title: In need of care and attention inside

reviews.text: From the outside the hotel looked fine - clean and brightly painted. But inside the public rooms and corridors were dark - with shabby carpets and dark cream colored walls. The suites were large with bedroom, bathroom, kitchen area and living space with a sofa, one armchair and a coffee table. The bedroom and bathroom were clean and the kitchen area well equipped with fridge, dish washer, microwave and two cooker rings, but the living room was in need of some cleaning. The floor was covered in stains and so were the sofa and chair. When we moved the sofa it was clear that it had not been moved to clean under for a very long while. We expect better for over $200 per night.
reviews.title: Jiminy Peak Nice Mountain So-So Hotel

reviews.text: Such a pity as the location is so picturesque.
reviews.title: Beautiful views!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Jiminy Peak Country Inn because we were attending a wedding there. While the wedding was absolutely wonderful and magical, the actual resort had some less than desirable aspects.
reviews.title: Slopeside convenience

reviews.text: The chief complaint would be that the walls and ceiling are PAPER THIN! You can hear EVERYTHING at night in the rooms around you. You can actually hear people urinating in the toilets in the room above you. Not the most pleasant way to try and get to sleep
reviews.title: Nice for quick vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property was what I expected, but a little bit better. The location between Lenox and Williamstown is central for exploring the area. The inn is clean, quiet, comfortable and the staff is pleasant. The room layouts are fantastic with a bedroom, living area and kitchen. It's a great setup for families because there is a sleep-sofa and 2 sinks in the bathroom with a door between for privacy. There are lots of adventure activities in summer and the mountain looks great for skiing. My only suggestions for improvement are maintenance should touch up the minor scuffs on the walls and the website should be updated to list air conditioning. Some ski resorts do not have it, so I always verify before booking. The staff also fulfilled my request for a top floor room. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Choice for The Berkshires

reviews.text: We loved staying here. The suite was very spacious and very clean. There was a large bedroom with a comfortable bed and a large living area with a fully equipped kitchen. The grounds were well maintained and there's plenty to do with the family. The front desk staff (Dallas and Kaitlin) were very pleasant, friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful location - Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: This is a tough review to write because we did have a great time. We were there with a large group and our kids loved it. We stayed in the Country Inn. We checked in with Donna, who was so warm and inviting and lovely with my kids. We had a misunderstanding with the adventure tickets and I thought she meant that they were included in our package. So, I made a point to use them. I was very surprised to get a bill the last day!
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.text: The suites are a good size for a family of four with a king, one bedroom and a pull out sofa in the living room. There is a small kitchenette and a bathroom with tub and two sinks, one separate from the rest of the bathroom, which was handy. The downside of the room was the furnishing was a little outdated and we did see bugs. We saw several very large ants, a large spider and some other bug. My kids hate bugs, so this was a problem for us.
reviews.title: Wonderful service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There are two TV's. One of our remotes was missing a back and a battery and I called for a replacement, which was brought up right away. The housekeeping was efficient.
reviews.title: Pleasant vacation

reviews.text: Just stayed here (Feb) midweek with three adults. Very good value for money, rooms are very well equipt, fridge, coffee maker (with decent coffee), dishwasher, TV's microwave, kitchenware etc etc. Our room was located down the hallway from the restaurant, which was handy. We stayed here with three people - wife and I got the bed and friend got the pull out bed. The bed was VERY nice, slept very well (and i'm a bed snob). My friend reported the pull out bed was fine too.
reviews.title: Great value and very comfortable

reviews.text: All in all would have given this five if it wasn't for two factors; our room smelt of smoke when entering, believe the place is non smoking so didn't know why. Secondly the shower head was way too low for a 6ft2 guy so be prepared to do a limbo if you're like me.
reviews.title: Fun Summer Weekend

reviews.text: Would 100% stay here again, the lift tickets included in the stay made it well worth it too.
reviews.title: Empty but cold

reviews.text: We went on a Groupon Deal for a weekend in August. The hotel was very nice and the adventure park and playground were fantastic. It was very crowded as there were many groups so the lines were long. The two restaurants on site were great. Some of the places like the ice cream/snack stand and country store had limited hours and seemed to close early. There was no indoor pool and the outdoor pool was so cold my kids had to "swim" in the outdoor hot tub which was the temperature the pool should have been. The indoor hot tub was much warmer. The facility and service was fine and we had an enjoyable time. Many things were expensive and even cost extra money with your adventure park wrist band (zip line and chair lift ride).
reviews.title: Poor customer service

reviews.text: Stayed at Country inn day after MLK day , place was trashed inside ,was told they had 140 checkouts that day. We arrived at 11:30 pm. Security guard in lobby at corner desk on laptop didn't even look up. So, we excepted the place was empty . Our room was on 3rd floor ,furthest away from lift,when I asked about a room close to lobby or lift,was told "oh ,you booked online"
reviews.title: Worst hotel stay in years

aka: Country Inn At Jiminy Peak Hotel
description: The Country Inn at Jiminy Peak Mountain Resort is an all-suite hotel located centrally in Berkshire County. Winter guests enjoy slopeside access, roaring fireplaces in the lobby and an outdoor heated pool, open year round. Summer guests can take advantage of its immediate proximity to Mountain Adventure, Jiminy Peak’s collection of mountain-themed rides and attractions. Guests staying at the Country Inn have easy access to John Harvard’s Restaurant and Brewery located on the 3rd floor, as well as the Country Store, just a minute’s walk from the hotel. Also nearby is Just Jiminy, a logo shop for all your souvenir needs and in the winter Mountain Sports by Potter Brothers can equip you head to toe in new gear.
